requirements.name: Statement of Information (SI-100)
requirements.description: Annual statement filed with the California Secretary of State providing current information about the nonprofit corporation
requirements.due_date: Within 90 days after close of fiscal year

requirements.name: Charitable Registration (CT-1)
requirements.description: Initial registration with the Registry of Charitable Trusts for organizations soliciting donations in California
requirements.due_date: Within 30 days of first receiving assets

requirements.name: Annual Report of Charitable Trust (RRF-1)
requirements.description: Annual financial report filed with the Attorney General's Registry of Charitable Trusts
requirements.due_date: 4.5 months after close of fiscal year

requirements.name: Form 990 Series
requirements.description: IRS Form 990, 990-EZ, or 990-N required for tax-exempt organizations

requirements.name: Exempt Organization Annual Information Return (Form 199)
requirements.description: California Franchise Tax Board annual information return for exempt organizations
requirements.due_date: 15th day of 5th month after fiscal year end

requirements.name: Commercial Fundraiser Registration
requirements.description: Registration required if using commercial fundraisers or fundraising counsel

requirements.name: Unemployment Insurance Registration
requirements.description: Register with the Employment Development Department if organization has employees

notes: California has robust nonprofit oversight with requirements through both the Secretary of State and Attorney General's office. The Registry of Charitable Trusts closely monitors organizations receiving donations.

key_agencies.name: California Attorney General - Registry of Charitable Trusts
